Rust Analyzer Changelog #191

2023/07/24
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

The latest release of Rust Analyzer, version 0.3.1599, brings several new features and internal improvements. One notable new feature is the fix for highlighting byte escape sequences, addressing issue #15303. Additionally, the change_visibility assist is now limited to top-level items, as requested in issue #15277. Another improvement is the exclusion of raw pointer dereferences when considering method receiver candidates, as outlined in issue #15312. The update also includes the ability to look up supertraits in is_dyn_method, resolving issue #15317, and reporting incorrect-ident-case for inner items, as reported in issue #15320. Furthermore, the expected type in call arguments is now normalized, fixing issue #15325.

Internally, this release introduces various improvements, such as the use of notification command links for debugger installation, demonstrated in issue #15290. It also includes a configuration example for Kate, as contributed in issue #15313. Additionally, the update supports reading uncompressed proc macro metadata, as addressed in issue #15301. Other internal changes include the removal of the crate visibility modifier, optimization of DepKindInfo to DepKind conversion, and the utilization of .kind(Interner) instead of .data(Interner).kind.

Developers using Rust Analyzer will find these updates beneficial for their coding experience, with improved highlighting, better assist functionality, and enhanced internal processes. Stay tuned for more updates on Rust Analyzer and other programming languages and frameworks in future issues of Dev Radar.

2023 | dev-radar
